metadata.title: CVE-2023-2162 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in iscsi_sw_tcp_session_create indrivers/scsi/iscsi_tcp.c in SCSI sub-component in the Linux Kernel. In thisflaw an attacker could leak kernel internal information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
